history_entry.old_value: looking into orsa docs. three units sketched in libraries\liborsa nanobit tried to compile with mingw
leapfrog implemented in orsa_integrator. orsa_vecmath unit added.
orsa_frame.pas initial. overloading signature of functions.
TVector class is working. test unit implemented.
Tests for TBody done. looking into TEvolution.
additional functions in TEvolution. orsa_constants added. initial steps toward Relativistic interaction, see http://www.projectpluto.com/relativi.htm
TFrame succesfully tested. TestUnits interface modified, to be slightly more logical.
initial TInteraction test, however still some trouble in compiling.
TInteraction test done. Initial test unit to test TIntegration now.

Interaction as an interface, initial tests for integrator, but some AV around. First attempts to sketch TimeStep and UniverseTypeAwareTimeStep.
Hope we can use TDateTime instead of the orsa TimeStep and related structures.
TDateTime could work. There is also a TDateTimeStep in Unit TeEngine (see help).

no av in TestIntegrators anymore after changing interface IInteraction to abstract class TInteraction with virtual abstract on top and override on derived classes. However, the center of mass does not change after applying a leapfrog step.
Near Earth Objects plugin
Near Earth Objects library
LeapFrogIntegrator seems to work. now i should try another integrator.
TestEvolution initial revision. TestIntegrators tests up to 500000 integration steps. TBody implements destructor. TEvolution compiles. TInteraction frees vector d.
TRadau15Integrator works but delivers too high numbers after e.g. 500 iterations.
after moving end statement of main loop at the correct place, first step of Radau integrator is equal with first step of LeapFrog. Radau Integrator added into TEvolution as well.

FindOrb site: http://www.projectpluto.com/ifindorb.htm#Storia
out of orbital elements and using least square methods ephemerids are computed.
all planets in ORSA. relativistic interaction fixed twice, once by me, once by nanobit: then we had elliptic orbits :)

task.detail: Terragen 2 will stay free for personal use... http://www.planetside.co.uk/terragen/tgd/tg2faq.shtml
task.creator: dangermaus

history_entry.old_value: Terragen 2 is available at: http://www.planetside.co.uk/terragen/download.php?item=tg2freewin
a tutorial to add planets and moons in Terragen 2 is here: http://www.designpaths.com/terragen-tutorials/adding-planets/

Analysis results: data on http://www.gpu-grid.net/gpu/exp/tg2/tg2-firstlight.zip
I was able to generate a picture with a planet by following the tutorial (probably no way to add Saturn rings).
The format of the project file changed from .tgw which was not human readable, to a non standard XML .tgd which is human readable.
Currently, the tgdcli.exe, which is the command line interface to Terragen is broken and does not accept parameters.
Terrain file is now specified in .tgd. Probably no flag to give it on the command line.
If .tgs files generated by Terranim should not be supported by the command line tgdcli.exe, then no problem: one could easily parse .tgs and fill into the tgd camera position and view angles.
If command line will be fixed for the free non commercial version, it will take about one weekend of work, to make GPU Terragen 2 compliant.
command line for tgdcli.exe might be: tgdcli.exe r:\tgd\nt_intel\sdf.tgd -f1 (taken from a forum).

GPUs which are idle go and take stuff from this pipe when they are idle

task.summary: solve duplicate's problem with circular buffers
task.detail: in the same way as chat does it :-)
task.creator: dangermaus

history_entry.old_value: solved with 0.879. many performance improvements possible like: - circular buffer of hash functions - GUID instead of Data

string approach was probably slow. GUID approach was fast, but many data packets were carried by the same packet, so GUID was the same.
Right now solved with a simple hash function... hope this will work...
now mixed approach: hash for gnuQuery and gnuQueryHit, GUID for ping pong and push. this in the latest forced autoupdate to 0.842
now ping pong behaviour seems better. still missing some elegance.

task.detail:
GPU Islands is the new GPU II: it has to be a central server in PHP that creates GPU cluster islands. The communication between an island of clients is done like in GPU I. Clients see clients of other islands through the GPU Islands Server. The GPU Islands Server is able to show clients on a map. Islands can be defined automatically by the server or created manually on the server. Tasks are submitted centrally to the server. Later on: several Island Servers can exchange tasks.
The communication between islands is done only if a client requests a bridge between islands (if the bridge is on another server, logic behind that should create a logical superbridge between servers). For this reason, bridges should be defined in abstract manner and implemented such that they do not work only on one server, but between servers.
GPU Islands has to be easy to install (like the coming deltasql 0.811) and have a backend in mySQL.
Distributed computing will be done via work units as in File Distributor, via jobpipe, via GPU vm tasks.
API: defined three times as HTML, csv, and XML in the response part. Request part as URL with parameters.
Any client has to be able to use this simple API.
If possible implement the client in freepascal.
